title: Friends fans - it's been 20 years since Ross and Rachel went on a break

organizations.name: facebook follow us on twitter celebs newsletter follow @mirrortv subscribe

text:
Friends fans - it's been 20 years since Ross and Rachel went on a break The time has flown by - let's relive the defining TV moment Share Comments By Alistair McGeorge 12:26, 14 FEB 2017 TV Video Loading Video Unavailable Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Watch this video again Video will play in 20 years since Ross and Rachel from Friends went on a break Share this video Watch Next It's hard to believe it's been two decades Ross Geller and Rachel Green made TV history by going on a break.
Friends fans will remember all too wall the drama that came after this defining moment, which had a big impact on the show's storylines and was referenced by characters for a long time afterwards.
On 13th February 1997, The One Where Ross And Rachel Take A Break aired for the first time, with the on/off couple arguing on their anniversary.
In The One The Morning After, Ross and Rachel had to deal with the fallout (Photo: NBCUniversal) "Maybe we should just take a break," Rachel suggested, as her boyfriend took it to mean a temporary cease-fire in their row.
Read More Why Jennifer Aniston says you REALLY won't see a Friends reunion We know how that went.
Things would never be the same (Photo: NBCUniversal) "No. A break from us," she added.
Read More It's The One Where They Replaced Courteney Cox as Friends fans notice "world's worst stand in" for Monica A generation still isn't over that moment, and it did lead to some of the most memorable lines and stories over the next seven series.
Meanwhile, David Schwimmer brought Ross to life in the series - and now, you can rate the Palaeontologist as if he were your very own college professor.
The cast of Friends (Photo: REUTERS) Forget whether Ross and Rachel were on a break or not - on Rate My Professor fans are much more interested in what grades he gave, what the quality of his lessons were like and if youâ€™d take his class again.
Witty online Friends fans have jumped at the chance to rate the fictional New York University professor, with his overall quality scoring an above average 3.8 out of 5.
